website_summaries.verdict: Great gloves for working outside in winter, as they're lined for warmth and also protect against chemicals.
pros: Gloves measure about 12 inches from fingertip to cuff, so they provide a nice level of protection against chemical splashes
Gauntlet cuff, so you receive protection for your wrists when needed
Thickly lined interior keeps you warm during winter work sessions
cons: Odd design, as these gloves have a loose feel between interior and exterior

customer_reviews.title: Nice waterproof gloves that run very big.
customer_reviews.text: I used them while power washing in near-freezing temperatures. The material is nice and thick but they’re big. I was able to wear a pair of gloves under these gloves. Normally I wear a large in gloves but occasionally can wear XL. Dexterity was horrible but my hands were very warm. I wouldn’t have a use for gloves this oversized if not for power washing in late fall. For that, they were just fine.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Very durable, very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I'm a semi truck driver and haul trash to a landfill. I have been doing this for 13 years now and I wish I knew about these gloves a long time ago. During the winter time I struggle with cold wet Frozen hands and not anymore since I've began using these gloves. If you work in the outdoors and wish to keep your hands warm and dry, give these a try
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Green

customer_reviews.title: We use them to fuel race cars
customer_reviews.text: In the series we race in, the person fueling the car needs to be in "full race gear" in case of fire. Well, the problem is if you splash gas on your fancy race gloves, now a) you smell like gas and b) there's gas held against your skin, causing a rash or worse. We bought these in XXL so that we can jam our hands in them *while still wearing race gloves*. Our hands are now doubley-protected, these are far more grippy than race gloves (making it less likely to fumble with a gas can). When done filling, you can just shake these off and get back out on the track.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Vier

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY STIFF & HARD
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for working with oil and diesel. Whenever I first received this pair I was extremely pleased. I was initially was very impressed with the warmth and construction of the gloves, but after only 2 days of use in 20-40 degree temperatures the gloves became EXTREMELY stiff and hardened almost to the point in which the gloves were unusable. Now after 5 days I can't even move my hands while inside them. I read numerous reviews and it doesn't seem like anyone else has had this problem so I am confused as to why this is the case for me.
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Good cold, wet weather glove!
customer_reviews.text: These are similar to the Atlas 490s:  You can see my review there. These are one size and equivalent to an XL. I wear a large in the 490s and use these with a liner when its really cold. If you have big hands they are a bit cheaper then the Atlas.
customer_reviews.author: zman

customer_reviews.title: Wells Lamont 194 Heavyweight Fully Coated PVC Glove
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair of these gloves for use when operating my snow blower. They allow me to flex my fingers, and keep my hands warm and dry. While the cuff is large and open, my bulky coat's arms block most of the cold from entering. However, they are very large. I am a tradesman, and work with my hands. I usually wear either a large or extra large work glove, depending on the manufacturer. These feel like a double XL. I think I could wear cotton jersey gloves, AND still wear these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Look good
customer_reviews.text: Have not use them yet but I am going by other reviews ,Plan on using them for canning and processing /scalding poulty and maybe plowing in the winter on tractor if they are warm enough
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Perrea

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but..
customer_reviews.text: They work ok for moderately cold temps. I am in West Texas and when the wind blows or it gets down below 30° , your fingers will get numb if you're out for too long. I have been looking for some type of really thin glove to wear under these but haven't found anything locally yet. I bought two pairs and haven't used them for very long, so I can't comment on longevity but they feel nice and thick and fairly sturdy. One thing I will say is that they are WAY better at keeping your hands warm than regular neoprene/rubber gloves that your company will most likely give you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are warm, comfortable and easy to clean. They look like they will last for quite some time. I know I'm not the first to say this, but the fingers are definitely too long, making even semi-intricate work a challenge with the ends just wobbling around. The winter here was so rough that it was a sacrifice I could live with to avoid frostbite, but the product would be 5 star if just a little length was shaved of the fingers(and I don't have short hands!).
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I use these at the airport in freezing weather and water. My hands never got cold or wet.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Fitterer

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: Starts to stink on inside of gloves after short time of using.
customer_reviews.author: Chauncey

customer_reviews.title: I may have purchased used🤷‍♂️
customer_reviews.text: One size fits all, not in my experience. The left glove was so much smaller in size that I could not wear it
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Fraudulent description:  "1 size fits most."
customer_reviews.text: Fraudulent description: "1 size fits most." These gloves are XXL. I am returning mine & have a refund.
customer_reviews.author: J. OSORIO

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof and Warm Gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves met my expectations for being waterproof and warm while I was out shoveling and snow blowing snow. I only gave 4 stars as I found the inside lining gets damp from sweat and snow when shoveling and takes a pretty long time to dry out. Other than that no issues and overall I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: For winter only
customer_reviews.text: I gave these as a gift to my landlord and he told me he loves them. These gloves keep his hands warm and dry when he shovels snow or uses the snow blower. Plus, no slippage on the grip. These are a must-have for anyone who does anything outdoors during winter. The quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: pgh girl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for gasoline Excellent for very cold weather I will ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for gasoline Excellent for very cold weather I will be back to review it after spring and the summer to see if it’s all year gloves
customer_reviews.author: MHG

customer_reviews.title: Great for cold weather not great for dexterity
customer_reviews.text: I use these for deicing aircrafts and they keep my hands warm all day and are perfect for using the hoses. But if you need any dexterity then these might not be the gloves for the job.
customer_reviews.author: mr bacon

customer_reviews.title: For a warm grip
customer_reviews.text: Wife uses them when digging through the cooler for fish . She likes them .
customer_reviews.author: BEAST MODE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: have used these gloves in the past for barbeque cooking, they eventually become rigid after continued use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for snowblowing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for snowblowing and after using them once, I'm very impressed. We've had several feet of snow already this year (4+feet) and every other pair of gloves I've tried has gotten soaking wet and frozen. These gloves are large..big enough to wear other gloves underneath..but I wore them alone and had no issues (I normally wear a women's large). To summarize, if you want to keep your mitts dry and warm while being out in the elements, buy these!
customer_reviews.author: imadidi

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend these gloves for truck drivers who chain up regularly
customer_reviews.text: I use these for chaining up my big rig. I highly recommend these gloves for truck drivers who chain up regularly. They are insulated and keep your hands dry and warm. You will thank me later. No joke
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: these gloves are great for washing my two cars when the temp is ...
customer_reviews.text: these gloves are great for washing my two cars when the temp is below 45 degrees. Just be careful when you lean on the wet surface because these guys don't really have any grip and will slide right off. But this is very minor compared to the benefit of not having frozen hands.
customer_reviews.author: Mustang

customer_reviews.title: I use these gloves while canning. I can reach ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves while canning. I can reach into a boiling water bath canner and grab a jar ,take the jar from the canner, not worry about the jar slipping from my hand, nor being burnt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for working in the rain
customer_reviews.text: Used it to work on the ramp at the airport during rain, and it worked perfectly. Kept all the water out. Only problem was the lining came out a bit too easily but its a minor problem. If you double up on gloves, it'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: So far these gloves work great for cranking landing gear when they are covered in salt and snow.
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: Good glove
customer_reviews.text: they're good but once it gets below 0°F outside it's almost impossible to bend your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Campos

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made gloves. Gloves stay pliable at 0 degrees. Good grip to the gloves. Fleece lining keeps your hands warm. Would recommend to anyone, needing a glove of this type for outdoor work in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality
customer_reviews.text: Fits like a glove! I use them most every weekend lobster netting and they are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Mike A.

customer_reviews.title: He said they work great and help his hands stay dry and warm He ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for husband because he has to wash cars outside on the winter. He said they work great and help his hands stay dry and warm He said he lends them to his co-workers and they also like them
customer_reviews.author: D San Soucie

customer_reviews.title: ... the gloves for outdoor col weather and they is good to have
customer_reviews.text: I use the gloves for outdoor col weather and they is good to have.
customer_reviews.author: George Berry

customer_reviews.title: One size fits all?
customer_reviews.text: A bit big for my hands, which typically fit well in large size gloves. Don't expect much dexterity or warmth either. They work as waterproof gloves for miscellaneous winter chores that don't take hours.
customer_reviews.author: Erich Schindelbeck

customer_reviews.title: The BEST gloves money can buy
customer_reviews.text: If U work in the COLD and w/ diesel fuel ! The BEST gloves money can buy !
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT J MCKENZIE

customer_reviews.title: Highest recommendation for North Dakota Oil Field
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are perfecthe for the Oil Field in North Dakota. They provide the best warmth for your hands in the winter, as well as the protection from crude oil. Highly recommend these gloves
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two pair and am still using the first one.They are very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ron & Brenda Dale

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect glove for wet cold weather, wear them at work when it is raining.
customer_reviews.author: charles schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. Very warm so be careful if you are wanting to use these any other time then during winter!
customer_reviews.author: Jonesphotog

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Like these gloves. I wear them outside when I know my hands are going to get really wet and it's cold outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: V. Boraas

customer_reviews.title: Wore outside today in 4f weather kept my hands extremely ...
customer_reviews.text: Wore outside today in 4f weather kept my hands extremely warm was out for 5 hrs. And never got cold
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are wonderful! My husband uses his for work everyday. A must-have for winter outside jobs. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: PATRICIA SWAYER

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit for big hands. Comfortable. Use as diesel mitt.
customer_reviews.author: Alison G.

customer_reviews.title: Barbaquing gloves.
customer_reviews.text: We use there gloves for barbequing chickens. The insulated quality makes it so you can grab ahold of the racks and turn them over without burning your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph A. Warner

customer_reviews.title: Way too big
customer_reviews.text: This is not a one sized fits all glove. I have size Large hands and found these unusable. They are big enough to fit another pair of gloves inside them. I would compare them to an XL or XXl ski glove. If you don't need any dexterity, they may work, but otherwise it did not suit me for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Really good gloves for working outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Really good gloves for my work outside. I would like to see more insulation on the inside but so far they have kept my hands warm when using them in temperatures in the single digits for up to a half hour. Can't say how long they will last as I have only had them less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: backpack1953

customer_reviews.title: Wells Lamont 194 Gloves
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived on schedule and in good condition. I primarily purchased this product for when I use my snow-blower; however, I have found many more uses for the gloves even in warmer weather such cleaning out the gutters on my home. A good product that I would purchase again, if/when needed!
customer_reviews.author: L-D-Runner

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Really great gloves,,,I use them for gold panning during the winter months,,,keeps my hands out of that cold water,,,,would buy again
customer_reviews.author: dabskie

customer_reviews.title: WINTER IS COMMING
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these gloves.They are very tough and very warm.I work outside and they keep hands safe and warm they do not get stiff even at single digit temps. I will buy agine
customer_reviews.author: fuzzy 2

customer_reviews.title: excellent hard working gloves for any hard job when it's wet & cold.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for outside work outstanding comfort and they keep my hands at just the right temperature.
customer_reviews.author: John M Feather

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very warm gloves and great for snow blowing in the Minnesota cold..
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan hill

customer_reviews.title: Inside feels warm and fuzzy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my authentic Breaking Bad costume. I paired it with "Dupont Large Yellow Tychem Qc Chemical Protection Coveralls" plus my 3M respirator mask I won a prize at a halloween party.
customer_reviews.author: JoesepHooah

product_meta.title: 12" Lined PVC Chemical Resistant Gloves, One Size (Wells Lamont 194)
product_meta.description:
Blue PVC (polyvinyl chloride) coating over cotton fleece shell. Lined with seamless winter terry knit brushed acrylic liner. Liquid and chemical resistant. Rough finish, straight thumb, 12 In. gauntlet cuff. 1 size fits most.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Wells Lamont 194 Wells Lamont 194 Blue PVC 12-Inch Lined Acrylic Winter Knit, Gauntlet Cuff, One-size - Heavyweight fully coated PVC glove. Very flexible and comfortable. Thermal lined with a brushed acrylic terry cloth liner for cold weather warmth. Roomy enough for an additional glove liner. Full 12 -Inch length for added protection. Completely waterproof and chemical resistant to gasoline, diesel fuel, most farm fertilizers, and water based chemicals. See our chemical resistant chart for more specific chemical limitations.
feature_bullets: PVC COATING - Effective against adhesives, liquids, detergents, and dilted bases and acids - Stays flexible at lower temperatures
LINED - Additional brushed lining for colder work environments
SUPERIOR GRIP - Textured PVC coating increases general gripping ability
GLOVE CUFF - 12-inch lined gauntlet cuff protects wrists and forearms
APPLICATIONS - Ideal for Woodworking, Auto Assembly, Trim Applications, Furniture Manufacturing, and More!

specifications.Included Components: Painting Supplies, Abrasives & Surface Preparation, painting-gloves
